context.description: Refactoring and modernizing legacy inventory tracking module with XP practices

technicalContext.stack: Legacy Java codebase, migrating to modern Spring Boot
technicalContext.existingCodebase: Brownfield with significant technical debt and low test coverage
technicalContext.teamExperience: Mixed - some experienced with XP, others new to practices

expectedOutcomes.storiesEstimate: 10-15 stories mixing new features and refactoring
expectedOutcomes.velocityEstimate: Start low (8-10), improve as tests added (12-15)
expectedOutcomes.practiceAdherence: Medium to high, focus on building practices gradually

specialConsiderations: Adding test coverage to legacy code is primary focus
Refactoring must be continuous to reduce technical debt
Collective ownership critical - no one person knows all the code
Sustainable pace essential - legacy work can be draining
May need extra spike stories for understanding legacy code
Strangler fig pattern for gradual modernization
challenges: Low test coverage makes refactoring risky
Complex legacy code requires pair programming for knowledge transfer
Technical debt may slow initial velocity
Team needs to balance new features with refactoring
